c13Land.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
c13Land.long_name: Mass of 13C in all terrestrial carbon pools
c13Land.comment: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. 'Vegetation' means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil. The 'soil content' of a quantity refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. Examples of 'forestry and agricultural products' are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites. 'C' means the element carbon and '13C' is the stable isotope 'carbon-13', having six protons and seven neutrons.

c13Litter.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
c13Litter.comment: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil. 'C' means the element carbon and '13C' is the stable isotope 'carbon-13', having six protons and seven neutrons.

c13Soil.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
c13Soil.comment: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. The 'soil content' of a quantity refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including 'content_of_soil_layer' are used. 'C' means the element carbon and '13C' is the stable isotope 'carbon-13', having six protons and seven neutrons.

c13Veg.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
c13Veg.comment: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. 'Vegetation' means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. 'C' means the element carbon and '13C' is the stable isotope 'carbon-13', having six protons and seven neutrons.

c14Land.comment: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. 'Vegetation' means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil. The 'soil content' of a quantity refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. Examples of 'forestry and agricultural products' are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites. 'C' means the element carbon and '14C' is the radioactive isotope 'carbon-14', having six protons and eight neutrons and used in radiocarbon dating.

c14Soil.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including 'content_of_soil_layer' are used. 'C' means the element carbon and '14C' is the radioactive isotope 'carbon-14', having six protons and eight neutrons and used in radiocarbon dating.

c14Veg.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
c14Veg.comment: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. 'Vegetation' means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. 'C' means the element carbon and '14C' is the radioactive isotope 'carbon-14', having six protons and eight neutrons and used in radiocarbon dating.

cLand.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cLand.long_name: Total Carbon in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools
cLand.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

cLitterCwd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cLitterCwd.long_name: Carbon Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
cLitterCwd.comment: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. 'Wood debris' means dead organic matter composed of coarse wood. It is distinct from fine litter. The precise distinction between 'fine' and 'coarse' is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood_debris_mass_content_of_nitrogen, surface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.

cfadDbze94.comment: CFAD (Cloud Frequency Altitude Diagrams) are frequency distributions of radar  reflectivity (or lidar scattering ratio) as a function of altitude. The variable cfadDbze94 is defined as the simulated relative frequency of occurrence of radar reflectivity in sampling volumes defined by altitude bins. The radar is observing at a frequency of 94GHz.

cfadLidarsr532.comment: CFAD (Cloud Frequency Altitude Diagrams) are frequency distributions of radar  reflectivity (or lidar scattering ratio) as a function of altitude. The variable cfadLidarsr532 is defined as the simulated relative frequency of lidar scattering ratio in sampling volumes defined by altitude bins. The lidar is observing at a wavelength of 532nm.

clcalipsoice.comment: 'Layer' means any layer with upper and lower boundaries that have constant values in some vertical coordinate. There must be a vertical coordinate variable indicating the extent of the layer(s). If the layers are model layers, the vertical coordinate can be 'model_level_number', but it is recommended to specify a physical coordinate (in a scalar or auxiliary coordinate variable) as well. 'X_area_fraction' means the fraction of horizontal area occupied by X. Cloud area fraction is also called 'cloud amount' and 'cloud cover'.

clcalipsoliq.comment: 'Layer' means any layer with upper and lower boundaries that have constant values in some vertical coordinate. There must be a vertical coordinate variable indicating the extent of the layer(s). If the layers are model layers, the vertical coordinate can be 'model_level_number', but it is recommended to specify a physical coordinate (in a scalar or auxiliary coordinate variable) as well. 'X_area_fraction' means the fraction of horizontal area occupied by X. Cloud area fraction is also called 'cloud amount' and 'cloud cover'. The chemical formula for water is H2O.

cldnci.long_name: Ice Crystal Number Concentration of Cloud Tops
cldnci.comment: Concentration 'as seen from space' over ice-cloud portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with ice cloud or, if available, it is the sum over all ice cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total ice cloud top fraction (as seen from TOA) of each time sample when computing monthly mean.

cldncl.long_name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Cloud Tops
cldncl.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration 'as seen from space' over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

cldnvi.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Values are weighted by liquid cloud fraction in each layer when vertically integrating, and for monthly means the samples are weighted by total liquid cloud fraction (as seen from TOA).

climodis.comment: 'X_area_fraction' means the fraction of horizontal area occupied by X. Cloud area fraction is also called 'cloud amount' and 'cloud cover'. The cloud area fraction is for the whole atmosphere column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. The cloud area fraction in a layer of the atmosphere has the standard name cloud_area_fraction_in_atmosphere_layer.

clmisr.long_name: Percentage Cloud Cover as Calculated by the MISR Simulator
clmisr.comment: Cloud percentage in spectral bands and layers as observed by the Multi-angle Imaging SpectroRadiometer (MISR) instrument. The first layer in each profile is reserved for a retrieval error flag.

cltmodis.comment: 'X_area_fraction' means the fraction of horizontal area occupied by X. 'X_area' means the horizontal area occupied by X within the grid cell. Cloud area fraction is also called 'cloud amount' and 'cloud cover'. The cloud area fraction is for the whole atmosphere column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. The cloud area fraction in a layer of the atmosphere has the standard name cloud_area_fraction_in_atmosphere_layer.

clwmodis.comment: 'X_area_fraction' means the fraction of horizontal area occupied by X. Cloud area fraction is also called 'cloud amount' and 'cloud cover'. The cloud area fraction is for the whole atmosphere column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. The cloud area fraction in a layer of the atmosphere has the standard name cloud_area_fraction_in_atmosphere_layer. The chemical formula for water is H2O.

clwvic.comment: calculate mass of convective condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

co23D.comment: report 3D field of model simulated atmospheric CO2 mass mixing ration on model levels

co2s.comment: As co2, but only at the surface

conccmcn.comment: includes all particles with diameter larger than 1 micron

concnmcn.long_name: Number Concentration of Nucleation Mode Aerosol
concnmcn.comment: includes all particles with diameter smaller than 3 nm

cropFracC3.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
cropFracC3.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 crops

cropFracC4.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
cropFracC4.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 crops

diabdrag.long_name: Tendency of Eastward Wind from Numerical Artefacts
diabdrag.comment: Other sub-grid scale/numerical zonal drag excluding that already provided for the parameterized orographic and non-orographic gravity waves. This would be used to calculate the total 'diabatic drag'. Contributions to this additional drag such Rayleigh friction and diffusion that can be calculated from the monthly mean wind fields should not be included, but details (e.g. coefficients) of the friction and/or diffusion used in the model should be provided separately.

dissi14c.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

evspsblpot.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
evspsblpot.comment: at surface; potential flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

exparag.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

expcalc.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

expfe.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
expfe.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

expn.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
expn.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.
